name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Introduction to Bridge
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Introduction to Bridge
long_desc: Students will learn to engage with the exciting world of bridge while building up partnerships with each other. Learn to take tricks, bid contracts, count cards, and work together to defeat other teams. In addition, the top finishers will have the chance to compete against other colleges in the Collegiate Bridge Bowl for a significant prize pool. No prior bridge experience necessary.

custom_fields.goals: Students will be able to play several rounds of bridge in succession, making the right play most of the time and knowing how to analyze the hand postsession.
custom_fields.key_topics: Students will understand how to bid in auctions, as well as defend or declare in the card play as necessary. In addition, they will learn various conventions in both bid and play to maximize their score.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Students will be assessed based on their knowledge of terminology and their ability to determine the best possible play throughout the course of the hand.
custom_fields.relevance: This course will build appreciation for this popular card game and prepare students for the summer Collegiate Bridge Bowl.
custom_fields.learning_resources: BridgeBaseOnline will be useful for practicing bridge; in addition, there are several bridge wikis which contain useful information on the topics covered in class.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Willingness to practice one to two hours outside of class is highly recommended to keep up with the concepts taught in class.
